entry.def: Sacking is rough woven material that is used to make sacks.
A sacking is when an employer tells a worker to leave their job.

means.word_mean: 1. coarse fabric used for bags or sacks
2. the termination of someone's employment (leaving them free to depart)

auth_sentence.content: High-flying editor Louise Chunn was devastated by her sacking.
